title: Incompleteness, Meaning, and What It Says About Us
summary: Gödel’s incompleteness theorem showed that even mathematics, the most precise tool we possess, carries within it inevitable limitations. Many saw this as a frustration, but it might be one of the most beautiful features of the universe. This article reflects on what incompleteness says about the nature of human thought, the limits of reasoning systems, the mystery of consciousness, and the search for meaning in a universe that owes us no answers.
